Topic.Title: New message board. You're kidding us, right?

Message.Msg: add me to that list .. i don't even like the visual format .... so what if people want to post links .... preventing links won't make the stupid bashers and hypers of "news letters" go away ... we just have to live with them .... fixing things that are not broken is a good way to go broke .... garce

Topic.Title: New message board. You're kidding us, right?

Message.Msg: I don't think this was a mistake at all. I think Yahoo is delibrately trying to discourage use of their finance message boards. They don't make money from the boards and it is a PITA for them to deal with all the spammer complaints, etc. Less board traffic means fewer headaches for them.

Message.Title: IBM CAN MAKE BLACK BEERY A BLUE BERRY, IBM WILL FLY.
Message.Msg: Aapl will soon eat ibm lunch if ibm does not acquire rimm.
like I said. IBM over 200 a gift.

Message.Title: MR. BUFFETT = THE TECHNOLOGY LEADER !!! (drops intc)
Message.Msg: Yes, Buffett dropped the monopolist strong-arming intc and he sold all 7.745 million intc shares. Also, Buffett fired the CEO of a Berkshire Hathaway subsidiary for "strong-arm tactics, links (urls won't post) : "Berkshire eliminated its 7.745 million share stake in Intel (INTC), worth over $204 million." # # # Buffet fired Abrahms - read on, "But it also reported company morale has been bad after Abrams fired sales executives and antagonized retailers by trying to "strong-arm them into exclusive distribution deals." Continuing... "Even so, it's extremely unusual for Buffett to drop his usual "hands-off" policy and fire the CEO of a subsidiary."
